text:
The following operations are available. 

|Operator |Description|h
|+|Addition|
|-|Subtraction|
|*|Multiplication|
|/|Division|
|&|Concatenation of two strings|

''Functions''

These may be used with either the prefix "math." or "@". Both `math.round(16.2)` and `@round(16.2)` will return the value 16.

|Function|Description|h
|abs(x) |Returns the absolute value of x|
|acos(x)|Returns the arccosine of x, in radians|
|asin(x) |Returns the arcsine of x, in radians|
|atan(x) |Returns the arctangent of x as a numeric value between -PI/2 and PI/2 radians|
|atan2(y,x) |Returns the arctangent of the quotient of its arguments|
|ceil(x) |Returns x, rounded upwards to the nearest integer|
|cos(x) |Returns the cosine of x (x is in radians)|
|exp(x) |Returns the value of Ex|
|floor(x) |Returns x, rounded downwards to the nearest integer|
|log(x) |Returns the natural logarithm (base E) of x|
|max(x,y,z,...,n) |Returns the number with the highest value|
|min(x,y,z,...,n) |Returns the number with the lowest value|
|pow(x,y) |Returns the value of x to the power of y|
|random() |Returns a random number between 0 and 1|
|round(x) |Rounds x to the nearest integer|
|sin(x) |Returns the sine of x (x is in radians)|
|sqrt(x) |Returns the square root of x|
|tan(x) |Returns the tangent of an angle|
|PI|3.14159...|

For the most part, these are the standard javascript math functions. Others will probably work as well.

title: Balance Test
creator: Stephen

text:
Unlike most of the other operations, the {{$:/core/images/format-balanced}} ~BalanceCheck function works on the entire tiddler being edited. It locates mismatched parenthesis [ ]{ }( ) and various tiddlywiki formatting marks such as `~~ // __ '' ^^ ,, @@`

A small pop-up will appear telling you what opening character does not match a closing character and highlight the text between the mismatched characters.

The routine stops at the first mismatch it fonds so it may be necessary to click the button several times to eliminate all mismatched pairs.

!!Plugin Tiddler
$:/plugins/sk/BalanceCheck

!!Associated Tiddlers

{{BalanceCheckList}}

!!Demonstration Tiddler
*[[Balance Test]]
title: BalanceCheck

text:
I will give a detailed explanation for how to can set up a commenting system like I have but for now this overview is all there is (but do feel free to snoop around):

*The thing is based on Google Drive //Forms//. You need a common Google account to use this (if you have a gmail address, then you have a google account). The commenter (//commenteur//?) does //not// have to have any account or register for anything.
*Google Drive features //forms// which are "questionnaires" that you can put up on the web and set access rights to. The killer is that the answers people fill in for one such public form are all automatically collected into a standard Excel-type spreadsheet in your Google Drive. Really a fantastic service from Google.
*So, in the commenting system here, what you see is an //iframed// such form. But the iframe is cut down to only display the "answer field" for a single question. This can be found in [[$:/_TWaddle/Buttons/Comment]], which is a remade "more" toolbar button.
*The iframe takes the current tiddler title as part of its src, so the comment really is tiddler specific and I get this info in that spreadsheet summary.
title: Comments using Google Drive 'Forms'

text:
! ...in dieses Programm.
Dies ist ein "TiddlyWiki" ein freies ~ContentManagementSystem, das in  einer Html-Datei gespeichert ist und in einem Browser betrachtet und bearbeitet werden kann. Ich werde kurz die Vorteile erklären, die es bietet:

!!! Das Wiki kann komplett auf dem eigenen Rechner gespeichert werden. 
* Man muss nicht Online sein, um damit zu arbeiten. 
* Dinge die Nutzer eingeben bleiben verlässlich auf dem PC, das ist unverzichtbar wenn man den Wiki nutzen will, um Ideen zu sammeln und Drehbücher zu schreiben. 
* Es steht zudem eine Serverlösung zu Verfügung, auf die Einträge wieder hochgeladen werden können, um sie zu sichern und für andere nutzbar zu machen.

!!! Die Daten sind in kleinen Einträgen "Tiddler" organisiert.
* Diese können nach Belieben gruppiert werden.  
* Es können unterschiedliche Reihen gespeichert werden, zum  Beispiel unterschiedliche Elemente einer Lektion oder die Szenen eines Drehbuchs.

!!!Der Funktionsumfang kann über Addons uns Scripte erweitert werden. 
* Einige Funktionen habe ich hier schon hinzugefügt die Zeitleiste, Video, Anmerkungen.
* Der Code des Wikis wie der Erweiterungen ist offen, sodass sich diese gut anpassen lassen.
* Es gibt eine sehr freundliche und hilfsbereite Community, die bei der Programmierung von Funktionen hilft.

!!!Bilder und Videos 
* können sowohl aus dem Netz oder von einer lokalen Datei eingebunden werden. Demonstration: [[Zabriskie Point (1970)]] (So komfortabel, dass man eine Inhaltverhältnis anlegen kann, um zu Zeitpunkten zu springen funktioniert das bislang leider nur bei Youtube)

!!Bearbeiten
*Die Bearbeitungselemente erscheinen, wenn der Cursor über der Titelzeile ist.
*Da man zum Speichern aus dem Browser auf der Festplatte schreiben muss, braucht man dazu eine browserspezifische Lösung. Für Firefox ist das ein Addon, das man hier installieren kann: https://addons.mozilla.org/de/firefox/addon/tiddlyfox/

!! Was noch geschehen müsste: 
* Es wäre sinnvoll einen "Editor" und "Parser" für Drehbücher einzubauen, der Einträge, die mit DB getaggt sind im entsprechenden Layout druckt.
* Einen eigenen Server aufzusetzen, damit Interessierte ihre Projekte bei uns hosten können.
* Erweiterung der Videofunktion auf andere Quellen
* Eine Art Diashow Funktion
* und natürlich der Inhalt...

wie gesagt, dieser Wiki hat außer Tests noch keinen Inhalt, da ich mich zunächst mit der Infrastruktur befasst habe. 
Unten ist nur eine unvollständige Liste mit Inhalten, die ich einbinden möchte; ich werde das parallel zu meinen Seminaren machen.
Wenn du einen bevölkerten Wiki sehen willst, kannst du dir meine Sammlung für Theaterunterricht anschauen. https://www.dropbox.com/s/837chmzhxky7wjm/DS%20Arbeitsfassung.html?dl=0
title: Eine kurze Einführung...
creator: JR

text:
{{$:/core/images/email}} Email Convert

When text from some email programs is copied into a tiddler, it contains `<` and `>` marks which TiddlyWiki interprets to have meaning as macros. Since there are no matching macros, TiddlyWiki can get confused. This function changes those marks to `<` and `>` to avoid the confusion. It also adds new lines to correct the email to Tiddler format. 

The routine also converts certain types of bullets into TiddlyWiki standard bullets.

!!Plugin Tiddler
$:/plugins/sk/EmailConvert

!!Associated Tiddlers
{{Email Convert List}}

!!Demonstration Tiddler
*[[Email Test]]
title: Email Convert
creator: Stephen

text:
Seine Theorie des epischen Dramas hat Brecht 1930 in den Anmerkungen zur Oper "Aufstieg
und Fall der Stadt Mahagonny" tabellarisch zusammengefasst:<<ref "Bert Brecht, Schriften zum Theater. Über eine nicht-aristotelische Dramatik. Berlin / Frankfurt: Suhrkamp 1957, S. 19-20.">>
<!--<sli01>

!Testing Tables  
</sli01>--><sli02>

|Dramatische Form des Theater| Epische Form des Theaters|
|handelnd| erzählend|
|verwickelt den Zuschauer in eine Bühnenaktion | macht den Zuschauer zum Betrachter,|
|verbraucht seine Aktivität | aber weckt seine Aktivität|
|ermöglicht ihm Gefühle | erzwingt von ihm Entscheidungen|
|vermittelt ihm Erlebnisse | vermittelt ihm Kenntnisse|
|Der Zuschauer wird in eine Handlung hineinversetzt| er wird ihr gegenübergesetzt|
|Suggestion | Argument|
</sli02>

|Die Empfindungen werden konserviert| werden bis zu Erkenntnissen getrieben|
|Der Zuschauer steht mittendrin, erlebt mit |  Der Zuschauer steht gegenüber, studiert|
|Der Mensch als bekannt vorausgesetzt | Der Mensch ist Gegenstand der Untersuchung|
|Der unveränderliche Mensch | Der veränderliche und verändernde Mensch|
|Spannung auf den Ausgang | Spannung auf den Gang|
|Eine Szene für die andere | Jede Szene für sich|
|Geschehen linear, macht keine Sprünge | Geschehen in Kurven, macht Sprünge|
|Die Welt, wie sie ist | Die Welt, wie sie wird|
|Was der Mensch soll | Was der Mensch muss|
|seine Triebe | seine Beweggründe|
|Das Denken bestimmt das Sein | Das gesellschaftliche Sein bestimmt das Denken|
|Gefühl | Ratio|
title: Episches Theater
creator: JR

text:
The rest of this Demo is dedicated to testing methods to embed media. The normal TW5 and html5-tags for images, video and sound work in the Presentation mode, but there is some work to be done to make intelligent shortcuts to link media on a local drive and to make it look good by default.
For example I would like the video to go fullscreen when playing, and I want keyboard shortcuts to start and stop playing.
There is a lot of work to be done and help is very welcome. You can leave here and have a look at the traces of the plugin which are normally removed when leaving the presentation. ...This button lets you exit and you can open $:/Temp/slide/01 to see how it works...

text:
Häufig die Rede vom Film als Wirtschaftsfaktor -  vor allem dann, wenn Sender begründen, warum Geld in Projekte gesteckt wird, die mit dem Kulturauftrag nicht zu rechtfertigen sind oder wenn noch stärkere Marktförmigkeit eingefordert wird.
Dabei entsprechen die von den Sendern unterhaltenen und alimentierten Produktionsfirmen dem damit implizit behaupteten Ideal einer freien Marktwirtschaft nicht im Ansatz. Wir befinden uns hier mitten in einer Planwirtschaft, die die Produktion von Softdrinks subventioniert, weil Softdirnks einen hohen Markanteil haben und ergo eine starke Nachfrage besteht. .
title: Filmwirtschaft
creator: JR

text:
You can add [[Font Awesome|https://fortawesome.github.io/Font-Awesome/]] to your wiki by using one of the sources below.

[[@tobibeer|https://github.com/tobibeer]] created a great reference page for how to employ Font Awesome with TiddlyWiki. I recommend you follow his instructions on how to install and use Font Awesome: http://tobibeer.github.io/tw/fa.

[[@TheDiveO|https://github.com/TheDiveO]] also created a Font Awesome plugin. See [[TW5FontAwesome Plugin|https://github.com/TheDiveO/TW5FontAwesome]]. However, his provided version is out of date.
title: Font Awesome for TiddlyWiki

text:
I am working on a way to do footnotes which can be displayed like with the strechtextMacro<<ref "http://stretchtext.tiddlyspot.com/">> and shown in footnotes by a filter like in Skeeves Footnotefilter<<ref "http://tiddlystuff.tiddlyspot.com/#Idea%20for%20a%20footnote%20filter">>.

I tried it with Tobis ~TextExcerpts<<ref "http://tobibeer.github.io/tb5/#Text%20Excerpts">> but I didn't get it to work...
I think I need something like Mat built in the cherrypicker<<ref "http://cherrypicker.tiddlyspot.com/">> but i do not understand how the trick is done. 
Is it possible to build something like the pick macro which segments all content surrounded by `<<ref"` at the beginning and `">>` at the end?.

And is it possible to automatically number these segments to get numbers for the notes and uniqueIDs for statustiddlers?.

click the stars * !

(The reveal function should be changed to have individual Staters but at the moment the main issue is the footnotes and endnotes which i do not get to work...)


!! Usage
The Macro should work like this:


`<<ref "this is a footnote">>`

> <<ref "this is a footnote">>

`<<ref "this is a footnote with Label" label="label">>`

> <<ref "this is a footnote with Label" label="label">>


!Footnotes

The footnotes should automatically be collected and shown in the *-Tab.

`<<footnotes>>`

> <<footnotes>>
!Endnotes
see [[Endnotes]]
title: Footnotes Explanation and Test.
references: The Footnotes should appear right here...
creator: Tobias Beer

text:
<sli01>

*[[Rambler.ru|https://nova.rambler.ru/]]
>Rambler.ru 是俄罗斯门户网站，也是俄罗斯三大门户网站之一 。 重点是无需科学上网。这个网站的搜索引擎是谷歌提供支持。网页搜索右下角显示由谷歌技术驱动。比百度良心 10000 倍。



*[[Bird.so|http://bird.so/]]
>Bird.so 关于技术问题的搜索结果来自 google 搜索、雅虎搜索、必应搜索的聚合；经过测试，优先展示 google 搜索结果，在大部分关键字的展示结果与 google 并无差异，比百度良心 3000 倍。



*[[yahoo|https://sg.search.yahoo.com]]
>雅虎的搜索结果对比百度和国内阉割版的 bing，良心 2000 倍，搜索结果准确，排名靠谱。。

</sli01>

<sli02>

*[[mezw|https://so.mezw.com/]]
>MEZW 搜索结果与 Google 并无太大差异。优点：国内正常访问，界面简洁。MEZW 搜索服务可以汇集国内外网页的搜索结果，登录帐号，更可自定义的屏蔽掉不希望展示在搜索结果中的网站。比百度良心 1000 倍。



*[[avira|https://search.avira.com/]]
>Avira 是世界著名的杀毒软件，中文名：小红伞，来自德国。 搜索引擎基于 ASK，搜索结果相较谷歌有差异，但相对准确比百度良心 800 倍。


*[[Ecosia|https://www.ecosia.org/]]
>Ecosia 是一个基于 Bing 和 Yahoo 的绿色搜索引擎，通过自身算法优化整合 Bing 和 Yahoo 的搜索结果，展示最优的结果。与 google 搜索结果有较大差异，但展示结果依然相对准确，比百度良心 500 倍。



**reference：[[来源|https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s?__biz=MzI5MDM4NTYwOA==&mid=2247484787&idx=1&sn=d740039d627c41c3f179f4e3a373b979&chksm=ec21fed4db5677c2a486bf1efd443d0c62bd6b48e3b0b2829e06eed6a0f9bc3b932dcf3fac22&scene=21#wechat_redirect]]

</sli02>

text:
!!$:/MetaTabs/Template
The principle of this plugin is fairly simple: 
Most of the functions rely on a viewtemplate: [[$:/MetaTabs/Template]].
The [[Toggle-Button|$:/MetaTabs/Button]] simply removes the ~ViewTemplate-tag from this tiddler.

!! METATABS BUTTONS
In the viewtemplate below the caption METATABS BUTTONS you find different buttons that set a tiddlerspecific State-Tiddler (here called stater) to determine which content shall be revealed. These buttons are in lists that make shure that they are only shown if an Items exist for a tiddler. In this plugin, a field called "source" is used to establish this relation, combined with a tag.

!!METATABS REVEALED CONTENT
In the bottom below the caption METATABS REVEALED CONTENT reveal-functions assign the shown content based on this stater. This contend is defined by macros in the Top of the viewtemplate

!!Templates to add new content
Tiddlers tagged "NewMetaTab" appear as Tabs below the "add"-button.
You can look at [[$:/MetaTabs/newIdea]] to see how this works

!!To create your own function and modify this plugin
* You start designing your own template, and tag it "NewMetaTab"
* create a filter that indicates whether your Item exists for a chosen 
* create a button that sets the stater to a chosen word in the Buttons Section of the [[$:/MetaTabs/Template]]
* create a reveal function that shows if the stater is in the revealed content section
* define a function what to show in the top of the template.

!!To adapt the language
There is a [[TranslationTiddler|$:/MetaTabs/Language]] to adapt the captions of the templates to your language.
The tags "Notiz","Idee", etc. are in German, and because they are used in Listfilters I cannot transclude these from the [[TranslationTiddler|$:/MetaTabs/Language]]. If you want to change this, you have to change the word manually in three places:

# in the Listfilter of the METATABS BUTTONS 
# in the Listfilters of macros at the beginning of the [[Template|$:/MetaTabs/Template]]
# and the $:/MetaTabs/newXY template.
title: How to adapt Metatabs to your personal needs
creator: JR

text:
You can show the Open Tiddlers as a presentation using the Ad-Hoc-Button {{$:/plugins/JR/slides/AdHoc/Button}}
`{{$:/plugins/JR/slides/AdHoc/Button}}` But you also can save Presentations for showing them later on. !How to choose the tiddlers and set an order? Gather the tiddlers you want to show in the storyriver. You can use the $:/plugins/JR/slidesnstories/Save to save the story as presentation
{{$:/plugins/JR/slidesnstories/Save}} This saves a list with the open Tiddlers to a field called "slideshow" in the Tiddler you name You can create a button to launch the presentation using this macro:
`<>`
title: How to build a slidesshow?
creator: JR

text:
Sometimes Tiddlers have too much content to be shown in a single slide. The Presenter Plugin allows you to divide Tiddlers into up to 10 slides. The slideshow displays tiddlers with slides and tiddlers without slides. Tiddlers without slides are transcluded completely, whereas in tiddlers with slides, only the slides are shown. To mark a slide surround its content with these marks like this:
` content to display `
You can use this {{$:/core/images/slideshow}} ~EditorToolBar button to set the slides
!keep If you want a slide to remain while the next is opend the number of the next slide has to be written in a field called keep.
This can also be done with the dropdown-menu of the ~EditToolbar Button.
{{$:/core/ui/EditorToolbar/slide-dropdown}}
title: How to divide Tiddlers into slides
creator: JR

text:
This is a first idea for creating kind of a footnote filter{{The idea appeared in the google Groups||footnote}}.

Footnotes will for sure have some kind of markup{{But they do not have yet||footnote}}. So the filter should be able to find this markup. I've implemented a "match" filter which works similar to JavaScript's string match, using regular expressions. As there is no markup yet for footnotes, I've created a footnote template tiddler which is used like this:

''{{''The footnote text''||footnote}}''

Using the filter it is then possible to create a list of all the footnotes appearing in the whole wiki:

{{Footnotes||code}}

See all the [[Footnotes]] of this wiki{{I admit that this an awful usage of footnotes||footnote}}{{Footnotes should be used for some references, not for stupid text||footnote}}.
title: Idea for a footnote filter
creator: Stephan Hradek

text:

For publishing scientific work I would love something with automatic numbers. 
It would be great to have a function to summon the footnotes of all tiddlers in the storyriver.

text: Here you can create Tasks which appear in the taskmanager ("Plans") in the sidebar. Each task is a Tiddler tagged task. The checkbox tags it "done", the x removes the Tag "task" and the ^ cycles through the tags plan, active and urgent (and by this determines where it appears in the sidebar).

text:
I started this project as an attempt to build a small Excel-like spreadsheet completely contained in ~TiddlyWiki. My inspiration was this project: http://jsfiddle.net/ondras/hYfN3/ though it accomplishes the assigned task, excel like capabilities in plain vanilla javascript and a tiny footprint, it does have problems in a ~TiddlyWiki environment. So I set out to build my own and [[Excel Like Table]] is the current result. It is called Mathcell because it is designed to do math in a table cell. Then it occurred to me that I didn't actually need the table other than as a reminder of the cell addresses. And thus I created the [[Inline Example]] and the [[Engineering Example]]. This is no replacement for Excel but if you need a little bit of very flexible math abilities in your wiki, this may fit your needs. Note: This routine uses the javascript "eval" function which some regard as very poor coding and a security risk. One seminal article went so far as to declare the "Eval is evil", [[Eval is evil, Part One by Eric Lippert|https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/ericlippert/2003/11/01/eval-is-evil-part-one/]] Two points to address here. Lippert agrees that the sort of operation is an appropriate use for eval. He says: >There are a few scenarios in which eval is invaluable. For example, __when you are building up complex mathematical expressions based on user input__, or when you are serializing object state to a string so that it can be stored or transmitted, and reconstituted later. Secondly, I haven't found any of the examples of eval causing problems when tried in this application. Every one I've tried simply evaluates as plain text, even if you could, you would simply destroy your own wiki. !!Operating Notes # Mathcells are entered in the format `<$macrocall $name="eval1" datatiddler="$:/sk/data" cell="a1" format="2" />` where the datatiddler is where you data will be stored and the cell is the field. The format entry is optional with the number representing the number of digits to the right of the decimal point that will be shown. Formatting is done in the American style: `1,236,440.00` for the examplle. # The {{FormulaResult Button}} button toggles between formulas and computed results # Any cell entry starting with an `=` sign will be interpreted as a formula. # Any entry that doesn't start with an `=` sign is not evaluated but simply returned as a value. #Data to be stored as fields in a user selected tiddler #Field/Variable names can be any legal field name. When used in formulas, they are distinguished from text by a leading `!!` such as !!length or !!area. #Complicated math functions are frequently easier to edit in the datatiddler. #Only parentheses `(` and `)` may be used for grouping. #Results that look like formulas generally indicate a mismatched set of parentheses in one of the formulas. #
<$transclude tiddler="Available Operations" mode="block"/>
#Circular references are where one variable ultimately depends on itself. For example if A5=B5 and B5=C5 and C5=A5, you have a circular reference. The program will report "Circular Ref" in all cells involved. ---- An [[Inline Example]] {{FormulaResult Button}} {{Inline Example}} !!Plugin Tiddler $:/plugins/sk/MathCell # ~MathCell Essential Tiddlers ## $:/macros/sk/eval.js ## $:/macros/sk/evalouter.js ## [[FormulaResult Button]] #Non-Essential Examples and Data Tiddlers ##[[Engineering Example]] ##$:/sk/engrexample ##[[Inline Example]] ##$:/sk/data ##[[Excel Like Table]] ##$:/sk/data1 ##[[Available Operations]]
title: MathCell
creator: Stephen

text:
As you will find, a lot of these ideas are realized in this concept: !Mechanism The slideshow relies on a list of Tiddlers stored in a field called slideshow. This list can be added to any tiddler which has a name to make you find it.
During the presentation these Tiddlers are gradually opend in the storylist.
When opening a Tiddler in the presentation a sets of temporary slides $:/Temp/slide/01 is created. Pressing the next button the field show in these Tiddlers is set to yes (rep. to no) to determine whether the content is shown in a list. When the last temporary slide is reached, the mechanism navigates to the next Tiddler. All temporary slides are deleted and the ones for the new slide are created.
title: Mechanism
creator: JR

text:
Plugins in TiddlyWiki5 are used to distribute optional components that customise and extend TiddlyWiki. You can install them from the [[official plugin library|Installing a plugin from the plugin library]] or from [[community sites|Resources]].

{{$:/core/ui/ControlPanel/Plugins/AddPlugins}}

Internally, plugins are a bundle of tiddlers packaged together as a single tiddler that can be installed, copied or deleted as a unit. The individual tiddlers within a plugin appear as ShadowTiddlers. See the PluginMechanism discussion for more details about how plugins are implemented internally.

Plugins can contain JavaScript modules, style sheets, and templates. Plugins can also be used to distribute ordinary text, images or any other content.


<<list-links "[tag[Plugins]]">>
title: Plugins
creator: JR

text:
!Embedding images Whether an image is shown of course relies on the fact that it has to be acessible in the given path structure. Because this Wiki was developped for showing presentations from USB-Sticks the focus of my imagemacro is lay on finding images in a folderstructure with two levels. This would also work with an online-repository with the same structure. The concept used here is described in this Tidder: [[Linking Media]]
The concept regarding images is that images can be shown in the background during all slides a Tiddler produces. Therefore their filename simply has to be put in a field called bgimg.

Or Images can simpy put in the slides. !InImage Macro <>

text:
Sidebar Help creates a tab on the sidebar which displays a user selectable help tiddler. It was originally intended to be used with Edit Toolbar specific functions, ergo the name, but can display any tiddler.

Tiddlers are turned to help tiddlers simply by adding an appropriate tag, `Help`, `EditorHelp` or `external` or one of many of the TiddlyWiki tags.

Tiddlers do not display exactly the same on the sidebar as they do in the main story so some care is required in creating these tiddlers.

!!Plugin Tiddler

text:
!SK Plugins for TiddlyWiki 5.12

!!The following plug-ins were developed for the Editor Toolbar that was introduced with version 5.12

#[[TableHelper]] - Converts blocks of comma separated or tab separated data into TiddlyWiki Tables

#[[TableCols]] - Adjusts the alignment of a user specified column to Centered, Left or Right justified as well as adding or deleting columns

#[[FindReplace]] - Adds Find and Replace capability to the Editor.

#[[Transclude]] - Marks a text selection as a transclusion

#[[Links]] - Marks a text selection as a link

# [[Indent]] - Indents a selected block of text

#[[BalanceCheck]] - detects and locates mis-matched parenthesis, braces, brackets and TiddlyWiki formatting marks

# [[Fancy Quotes]] - Changes the typography of a text selection to standard typgraphic marks

# [[Color]] - Adds text color or background highlighting to a specified block of text

#[[Email Convert]] - Revises blocks of text to change characters that would be misinterpreted by TiddlyWiki such as > and < to their html equivalents. Also adds spacing and converts bullets to TiddlyWiki equivalents.

#[[HTML Convert]] - Converts an imported to the TiddlyWiki equivalent.

!! Plug-ins not directly related to the Editor Toolbar
#SidebarHelp - Adds a tab to the sidebar area where help tiddlers can be displayed.
#WhiteList - Allows a user selected group of words that TiddlyWiki would normally treat as CamelCase words that will be considered ordinary words.
#MathCell - allows math operations within tiddlers
title: SK Plugins for TiddlyWiki 5.12
creator: Stephen

text:
Slides and Stories is a repository of the tools to optimize TW for scientific research and for presenting and publishing results. !SlidesnStories ...is a tool to save and reload sets of Tiddlers. This is already working, The aim is to develop a mechanism to transform these into instant slideshows. !MetaTabs is a tool which gives you the possibility to attach and show specific information in tabs at the bottom of each Tiddler: ideas, notes, tasks, stories and presentations, comments, annotations and footnotes.
It is inspired by MagicTabs and Tiddlyscholar by Alberto Molina Pérez, which are very elaborated tools that alas do not seem to be in active development any more. I wanted to change the behaviour in some ways. For example I wanted show tabs only if they have content.
!...furthermore there is * an export-plugin, * a footnote-plugin, * and a plugin to rearrange Tiddlers in the ~StoryRiver
title: slidesnstories.tiddlyspot.com

title: Slidestyles

text:
<sli01>Tiddly Wiki is a great tool for collecting and organizing thoughts.
But I thought for some time that it still needs a tool to present ideas and knowledge.<<| red>></sli01><sli02>

!How should a presentation be generated?
To my mind this should be possible in the same wiki you collect the ideas in.
And it should not need great effort to convert a publication into a slideshow and vice versa.</sli02><sli03>
It should be possible to save the actual story as presentation with a click.</sli03><sli04>

!How should a slide be defined?
</sli04><sli05>
One problem I saw was that the text I would use to describe a problem in a scientific essay is longer than the text I would display in a slide. 
</sli05><sli06>
Some Tiddlers just do not fit into a slide.
</sli06><sli07>
Making tiny tiddlers would make it a lot of extra work to build a slideshow.
</sli07><sli09>

!How navigation should work in presentations?
It should be possible to navigate through the slideshow clicking a button which is always at the same place, it should be possible to skip slides and to jump into the presentation.</sli09><sli10>
For presentations in front of a big audience, it should be possible to have a moderator mode.</sli10>
title: Some thoughts for a Presentation-Mechanism
creator: JR

title: Table Cols Demonstration
creator: Stephen

text:
~TiddlyWiki provides several macros for generating a tree of tiddler links by analysing [[tags|Tagging]]:

;<<.var toc>>
: A simple tree
;<<.var toc-expandable>>
: A tree in which all the branches can be expanded and collapsed
;<<.var toc-selective-expandable>>
: A tree in which the non-empty branches can be expanded and collapsed
;<<.var toc-tabbed-internal-nav>> and <<.var toc-tabbed-external-nav>>
: A two-panel browser:
:* on the left, a selectively expandable tree that behaves like a set of vertical tabs
:* on the right, the content of whichever tiddler the user selects in the tree

The difference between the last two has to do with what happens when the user clicks a link in the right-hand panel:

;<<.var toc-tabbed-internal-nav>>
: The target tiddler appears in the right-hand panel, replacing the tiddler that contained the link
;<<.var toc-tabbed-external-nav>>
: The target tiddler appears in the normal way (which depends on the user's configured storyview)

!! Structure

The top level of the tree consists of the tiddlers that carry a particular tag, known as the <<.def "root tag">>. Tiddlers tagged with any of those make up the next level down, and so on.

At each level, the tiddlers can be [[ordered|Order of Tagged Tiddlers]] by means of the <<.field list>> field of the parent tag tiddler. They can also be ordered by the macro's <<.param sort>> parameter.

The tree displays the <<.field caption>> field of a tiddler if it has one, or the tiddler's title otherwise.

Each tiddler in the tree is normally displayed as a link. To suppress this, give the tiddler a <<.field toc-link>> field with the the value <<.value no>>. In the [[examples|Table-of-Contents Macros (Examples)]], the SecondThree tiddler is set up like this. Clicking such a tiddler in the tree causes its branch to expand or collapse.

The table of contents is generated as an HTML ordered list. The `<ol>` elements always have the class `tc-toc`. Expandable trees have the additional class `tc-toc-expandable`. Selectively expandable trees (including those in the two-panel browser) have `tc-toc-selective-expandable`.

To make a table of contents appear in the sidebar, see [[How to add a new tab to the sidebar]].

!! Parameters

;tag
: The root tag that identifies the top level of the tree
;sort
: An optional extra [[filter step|Filter Step]], e.g. `sort[title]`

These two parameters are combined into a single [[filter expression|Filter Expression]] like this:

> `[tag[$tag$]$sort$]`

<<.var toc-tabbed-internal-nav>> and <<.var toc-tabbed-external-nav>> take additional parameters:

;selectedTiddler
: The title of the [[state tiddler|StateMechanism]] for noting the currently selected tiddler, defaulting to `$:/temp/toc/selectedTiddler`. It is recommended that this be a [[system tiddler|SystemTiddlers]]
;unselectedText
: The text to display when no tiddler is selected in the tree
;missingText
: The text to display if the selected tiddler doesn't exist
;template
: Optionally, the title of a tiddler to use as a [[template|TemplateTiddlers]] for transcluding the selected tiddler into the right-hand panel

[[Examples|Table-of-Contents Macros (Examples)]]
title: Table-of-Contents Macros

text:
TableCols was originally created to quickly change the alignment of an entire table column at once. 

Clicking on the {{$:/core/images/col-align}} button causes a drop down to appear :

{{$:/sk/ColAlignDropdown}}

Select the column you want to adjust and the alignment you want. The last two options are straightforward; you may either insert a column at that location or delete a column.

Caution should be used if one of the rows has fewer columns than the entered number.

text:
The TableHelper converts a text selection of comma separated entries or tab separated entries and converts it into a standard TiddlyWiki table.

There are two main options available under the $:/ControlPanel on the Settings Page. You may center all the new entries if you don't choose centering, your new table will be left justified.

The second option is whether to convert commas to new cells. If your primary source of tables are comma separated variable files (.csv) then you will want to select "Convert commas to new table cells." If your main source are files that are tab separated, such as an excel spreadsheet that has been copied and pasted, then you'll want to turn off this option.

Simply select the text you wish to convert into a table and click on the {{$:/core/images/format-table}} button on the tool-bar.

You may observe the last row of your table as missing the closing `|` or a `|` by itself on the row below the table. This happens when either the invisible carriage return at the end of the last row was not selected or the second carriage return was selected. Simply add or delete that `|` manually.

!!Plugin Tiddler
[[$:/plugins/sk/TableHelper]]

!!Associated Tiddlers

{{TableHelperList}}

!!Demonstration Tiddler

text:
@@border:1px solid crimson;padding:7px 15px;float:right;margin:0; [[Version 0.8.2|TextStretch Versions]] @@ !!''Make text short and expandable'' The ''TextStretch'' macro is a great tool <> to keep the message short. Your readers can discover more details easily. !! Features and Syntax ''Compact and powerful.'' Want to hide some content? `<>` will stretch it out when the dots are clicked: <>. Use presets for simplicity or define your own styles and flavors. Tell stories using complex [[nested structures|TextStretch Transclusion Examples]] and transclusion. !!! Full Syntax `<>` Try it: <> !!! Default Values The first line of the [[macro|$:/_telmiger/strex]] reads ``` \define strex(content:"TextStretch", label:"…", start:"[", end:"]", class:"", id="_false_") ``` If you prefer other <>, you can edit them there. !! Parameters Use quotation marks, if your parameter contains whitespace <>. If you want to use the default value, you write "" or nothing. ; content : Text you want to hide – you can use <> and HTML <
  • characters like "
  • lists
  • other elements …
    • that otherwise are difficult to transclude." "(?)" "x" "?" "hint">> ; label : Text on the button that <> the element. ; start //and// end : Texts on the buttons which close the element <>. ; class : Classes can be appended here. There are [[examples|TextStretch Examples]] for predefined classes. ; id : Control the activation of TextStretch elements defined in the same tiddler.<> Elements with identical //id// open and close <> which can be useful <> Elements with identical //content// open together too. You can separate them using unique id’s. <> !! Installation Backup your TiddliWiki <>. Drag the links from the following list to your Wiki, import, save and ''reload''. * macro: $:/_telmiger/strex * styling: $:/_telmiger/strex.css * macro for hashing: $:/_telmiger/utils/HashStr.js Drag the link TextStretch over too, if you want to keep <> these explanations. Have fun! New [[TextStretch Versions]] might be published on: http://tid.li/tw5/hacks.html#TextStretch !! Inspiration This [[thread in the TiddliWiki Google Group|https://groups.google.com/d/msg/tiddlywiki/biymRJTDWxY/5Vh-PxYvAQAJ]] was the ignition which made me develop my own version of a tool similar to * http://stretchtext.tiddlyspot.com/ or * http://www.telescopictext.com/ <> My initial goal was to detect [text], show only […] and expand on click. I was not able to master the detection part, but I think the result is much better anyway. !!! Thank You I am very greatful for Mat <" "<:-)">> – his example [[StretchText|http://stretchtext.tiddlyspot.com/]] showed me how something like TextStretch can be done. At the same time I would like to thank all other members of the friendly TiddlyWiki community for <>inspiring examples, tips and tricks they share. Thank you all! !! DWYWBDBM-Licence Do what you want, but don’t blame me ;–) Please [[drop me a link|FollowMe]] if you made something cool!
title: TextStretch

text:
!! 1. Standard ``` <> ``` Text before <> and more text after the example. ''Hint:'' Please close this example before trying the next. !! 2. Close Buttons Hidden ``` <> ``` Text before <> and more text after the example. ''Hint:'' This example has the same //content// as the example above and both have no //id//. This is why they open and close together and you can control both from above. !! 3. Standard Text Color ``` <> ``` Text before <> and more text after the example. ''Hint 1:'' Please close this example before trying the next. They use the same //id//. ''Hint 2:'' The style for this is defined in $:/_telmiger/strex.css and uses the `foreground` color from your current palette (see $:/ControlPanel > Appearance > Palette). !! 4. Standard Text Color & Close Buttons Hidden ``` <> ``` Text before <> and more text after the example. ''Hint:'' This example shares the //id// with the example above, so you can control it from there. !! 5. Start or End Button Hidden ``` <> ``` or ``` <> ``` Text before <> and more text after the example.
Text before <> and more text after the example. ''Hint:'' The elements are synchronised as both have the same content. !! 6. Block ``` <> ``` Text before <> and more text after the example. ''Hints:'' Class "blockcontainer" instead of "block" puts also the //label// in block mode. The class "blockinner" puts the parts //start// and //content// in one block. !! 7. Hint ``` <> ``` Text before <> and more text after the example. ''Hints:'' The start-part is replaced by ×. Setting class to "hint noend" removes the end-part. The z-index is 997. !! 8. Note ``` <> ``` Text before <> and more text after the example. ''Hints:'' Here the start-parameter is set to "x". Setting class to "note noend" removes the end-part. The z-index is 998. !! 9. Note Flex ``` <> ``` Text before <> and more text after the example. ''Hints:'' CSS flex layout is used to place the start-part after the content. Setting class to "noteflex noend" removes the end-part. The z-index is 999. --- !! Clear States You can close all TextStretch elements in this Wiki using this button: <$button> <$action-deletetiddler $filter="[prefix[$:/state/strex_]]"/> Clear ~TextStretch States

text:
I would like to integrate something like skeeves Footnotefilter into the Reference-Tab that I found on Stephan Hradeks's: http://tiddlystuff.tiddlyspot.com/#Idea%20for%20a%20footnote%20filter

{{Footnotes||code}}
Combined with a storylist-filter I think his would be fine for Endnotes:

```
<dl>
<$list filter="[list[$:/StoryList]search[||footnote}}]each[title]]">
<dt><$view field="title"/></dt>
<$list filter="[is[current]match:text/\{\{(.*?)\|\|footnote\}\}/(g)]" variable="footnote">
<dd><<footnote>></dd>
</$list>
</$list>
</dl>
```
...and this in the reference-tab at the bottom:

```
<$list filter="[is[current]match:text/\{\{(.*?)\|\|footnote\}\}/(g)]" variable="footnote">
<dd><<footnote>></dd>
</$list>
```
Unfortunately I cannot get it to work because there seems to be a secret ingredient: 

I cannot see where the ``<<footnote>> `` function in Stephan Hradeks's: http://tiddlystuff.tiddlyspot.com/#Idea%20for%20a%20footnote%20filter comes from.

Thanks for help
Jan

* $:/core/modules/filters/match.js

text:
Fancy Quotes should be able to correctly convert everything in this sample:

This is a sentence with some appropriate errors. Such as the double space after the periods. But does it apply to[[exciseTest]]? It Does! And ... the ellipsis is underused. And at 'according to authorities' cited [[exciseTest]] "Typography -- Who Cares?", "Free the Ordinary Quotemark", and "Typography Nazis must die". Now as it works out the 'average' typography Nazi is 6'2" tall and is located at 124^^o^^15'6". (Note in particular the "o".) If he happened to live in America during the '80s, then he would be required to say "I'm a lumberjack and I'm OK."  "I sleep all night and I work all day"! He would be unable to multiply 8x2.

text:
First of all I wish to thank all the altruistic programmers who build TW and so many useful plugins and specially to the fantastic people in the mailinglist who helped me learn about TW and build these tools ...

Slides and Stories is a repository of some modules I worked on, because I needed to adapt TiddlyWiki to the needs of my research... and that I now work with.
TW has always been a great tool for note-taking and collecting ideas. My purpose in SlidesNStories is to present the results of research in lectures and to turn them into articles and other publications.

text:
Without the WhiteList all of these CamelCase words would require the tilde `~` in front of them to prevent TiddlyWiki from turning them into links.

{{$:/sk/WhiteList}}

This routine consists of a modification of the core TiddlyWiki function that checks for the preceeding tilde and tells it to check if the word is in the WhiteList tiddler. If the word is in the WhiteList tiddler, then it is treated exactly as though it had the tilde.

!!Plugin Tiddler
$:/plugins/sk/WhiteList

!!Associated Tiddlers

# $:/sk/WhiteList - List of words to ignore camelcase
#$:/core/modules/parsers/wikiparser/rules/wikilink.js - core routine modified to implement whitelist

text: *Wiki一词来源于夏威夷语的“wee kee wee kee”，本义是“快点 快点”的意思。 *Wiki的发明人美国俄勒冈的程序员Ward Cunningham借用这个名字，开发的是一种非常快的创建和共享思想的方法。 [img image-height="10%" align='right'[https://github.com/inforabbi/mypictures.github.io/raw/master/img/Cunningham.jpg]] >Wiki理念是开放（Open）、共享（Sharing）、共同创作（Collaborative），并通过相应的版本控制（Version Control）、权限管理（Access Control）、格式化语法（Formating Rule）等机制保障其开放性、便捷性、组织性以及可发展性的宗旨。 *Wiki的发展，如今已经有了近100种基于Wiki理念的[[各类Wiki软件|https://www.wikimatrix.org/?filter=all#compare]]，Tiddlywiki是其中一种。
title: Wiki的来源
tags: Cunningham 坎宁汉 起源 wiki 基于Tiddlywiki的个人知识管理

text:
<sli01>
''本质上，个人知识管理就是个人对于知识的@@color:{{$:/palettes/Editor##alt-text}};搜集、组织、整理和利用@@的过程。''
体现为@@color:{{$:/palettes/Editor##alt-text}};输入和输出@@[[两个层面|https://inforabbi.com/LIS-C.html#%E6%88%91%E7%9A%84PKM]]。</sli01>

<sli02>
这里我们不讨论自从《连线》杂志那篇[[《Web is dead》|https://inforabbi.com/mywebcollections/Webisdead.html]]文章问世后，我们所感受到的互联网如何一步步走向封闭的信息孤岛。所有的信息都被封闭在一个个APP自家的庄园里，比如Webchat。当然我们所有的Internet内容都还是可以基于Browser打开，所以我们仍然可以以Web页面来关联我们资源。
</sli02>
title: 什么是个人知识管理？
tags: 流程 连线 Webisdead 基于Tiddlywiki的个人知识管理 tiddlywiki学习 知识管理 PKM

text:
<sli01>

*搜索工具
>[[Google的替代工具]]
>[[SCI-HUB|http://sci-hub.la/]] 突破知识产权垄断（[[sci-hub可用站点|http://tool.yovisun.com/scihub/]]）
>[[Semantic Scholar|https://www.semanticscholar.org/]]微软的学术搜索
>>微软联合创始人Paul Allen投资开发的新一代学术搜索引擎，几乎80%的文章都可以在上面下载。它可以自动计算这个文章的重要性、贡献，并且，对于一个文章来说，可以智能查找引用（如文章A引用了50篇引文，那么直接在网页上可以看到文章都是怎么描述引文的，而且，哪些引文对这篇文章贡献大。相应的，也可以查看这个文章被哪些文章引用了，都是如何引用的）,很给力！在检索时，还可以选择会议/期刊名称，作者，文章类型等等，比较丰富，好用。

</sli01>
<sli02>

>[[AMINER|https://aminer.org/]]
>>可以通过社交网络和数据挖掘统计出你想搜索的话题下面的专家和文章，对于进行以主题为目标的搜索非常有用！
>[[Microsoft Academic Search|http://academic.research.microsoft.com/]]
>>微软学术搜索Microsoft Academic Search是由微软自己研发的一种搜索引擎，它不同于微软的Bing，Bing也可以搜索学术内容，但是并不局限于此。微软学术搜索的查询结果排序主要是基于两个方面。1、查询关键词的相关性；2、微软自己的评级。
</sli02>

<sli03>

>[[DOAJ|https://doaj.org/]]
>[[PLOS|https://www.plos.org/]]
>[[Journal TOCs|http://www.journaltocs.ac.uk/index.php]]
>[[Library Genesis|http://gen.lib.rus.ec/]]搜书工具
>[[arXiv|https://arxiv.org]]
>>用来占坑和查阅最新的idea的。当你有一个idea，并且已基本完成实验和初步论文撰写后，你可以先把文章投在这上面占坑，向全世界宣告这个idea是你的，保护自己的idea，避免直接投期刊或者会议经过漫长的等待后出现不可预知的情况。当然你也可以在上面查阅最新的别人的idea，甚至可以直接引用它。

</sli03>

>[[中国政府法制信息网法律法规数据库|http://search.chinalaw.gov.cn/search2.html]]
>[[常用科研搜索网站]]
>[[如何提高自己搜索信息的能力]]

title: 基于Tiddlywiki的个人知识管理实践

text:
*搜索引擎
**综合搜索引擎：百度；谷歌；雅虎；搜狗；必应；
**集合搜索引擎：搜网
**行业搜索引擎：中搜
**学术、影视搜索：天网
**生活资讯、舆情、图书特色：盘古搜索
**网页、博客、图片、词典等英文类：有道
*搜索技巧
**文件类型搜索：使用filetype；如filetype:pdf 大数据（英文状态下输入冒号）
**定位固定网站搜索：使用site；如大数据 site:sina.com，即在新浪网站上搜索相关内容
**精确匹配搜索：使用「」；如「大数据行业」，表示将这五个字作为一个整体进行检索
**限制性网页搜索：使用intitle；如intitle:大数据，限定于搜索标题中含有大数据的网页
*数据库
**商业数据库
***国内数据库
****万德：定位于国内高端客户；市场占有率约80%；售价高
****恒生聚源：定位为机构客户；性价比较高；售价中等
****CSMAR：定位于学术与高校；金融数据较全；
****锐思：定位于学术；质量一般
****巨潮：属深交所，具有先天优势
***国外数据库（彭博、路透社、CEIC、OECD、Haver Database、Thomson Financial OneBanker）
****彭博：数据较全；售价高
**学术数据库
***国内数据库
****中国知网：国内最大；包括期刊、学位论文、统计年鉴
****万方数据：仅次于知网；包括期刊、学位论文
****人大复印资料：包括期刊、论文
****中国国家图书馆·中国国家数字图书馆
****维普：包括期刊、论文
****中经网：行业研究报告较多；宏观数据较全
****国研网：数据较为权威
****上海公共研发平台：包含较多数据库
***国外数据库
****EBSCO:包含较多商业数据
****Elsevier：学术文章较全；更新速度快
***免费数据库
****数据汇：全球最大的免费财经数据库
****数据圈：国内最专业的经济数据论坛；免费共享平台、行业研究报告、统计年鉴
****FRED：Federal Reserve Economic Data
****OECD：Theme Economics；联合国图书馆
****台湾学术数据库：http://fedetd.mis.nsysu.edu.tw/
****台湾大学电子书：台湾大学图书馆-公开取用电子书
**共享文库（若积分不够又想下载，可借助文库下载器，如冰点文库下载、易读下载、老张文库下载）
***国内
****百度文库：国内文档数据量最大；综合型
****豆丁文库：文档质量次于百度文库；收费
****爱问共享：综合型文库；可查找行业研究报告、电子书
****道客巴巴：综合型文库；文档质量较好
****智库文档：无需注册；文档内容多
****IT168文库：专业型文库；以计算机及IT技术相关的文档为主
****CSDN文库：全球最大的中文IT社区
****呱仕网：初创企业；以创业投资、证券市场等文档为主
****新浪地产：国内最大房地产类文库；包括房地产类相关政策、数据较全
***国外
***Scribd：全球最大的文档分享平台
***Docstoc：在线文档与图片分享平台
**专业论坛
***人大经济论坛：经济、学术类论坛；行业研究、统计年鉴较多；更新速度快；
***经济学家：经济学专业论坛；包括统计年鉴、行业报告、国内外数据
***随意网-经济论坛：新建论坛
***理想在线：股票券商研究报告
***迈博汇金：股票券商研究报告；收费
***博瑞金融：金融行业专业论坛
***华尔街社区：国内专业的金融论坛
***投行先锋论坛：投行专业论坛
***春晖投行在线：证券相关政策的汇编整合论坛
***中华股权投资论坛：投资专业型论坛
**政府部门
***国家统计局：权威
***工业和信息化部：工业及信息化数据
***中国人民银行：中国金融市场政策及运行相关数据
***银监会：银行金融相关数据
***中国海关：中国进出口相关数据
***国家知识产权局：专利相关查询
***中国证监会：相关政策及招股书披露平台；拟上市公司排队数据
***巨潮信息网：中国资本市场指定披露平台；上市公司i相关年报、季报及公告披露信息
***证券交易所（相关证券的募集说明书、年报和重大交易报告）
***上海证券交易所：研究报告
***深圳证券交易所：研究-刊物中有研究报告
***全国中小企业股份转让系统：新三板挂牌公司的转让及信息披露
***香港证券交易所: http://www.hkexnews.hk/indexc.htm
***台湾证券交易所：http://www.tse.com.tw/ch/index.php
***新加披证券交易所：http://www.sgx.com/
***纽约证券交易所：http://www.nyse.com
***纳斯达克证券交易所：http://www.nasdaq.com
**其他
***行业协会
***博客
***微博
***微信：相关公众号
***QQ空间：企业或机构QQ空间会公布信息发布渠道
***咨询公司及行业信息提供商：如麦肯锡、IMS、艾瑞咨询
***杂志网站：Nature、HBR、经济学人
***知识分享网站：知乎
***经济学资源数据库：http://down.cenet.org.cn/

[[来源|https://mubu.com/doc/gTeiTp1tk]]

text:
''董光壁先生是中国科学院自然科学史研究所教授。''，一位研究科学史，研究周易的易学大家，在2013年的时候在一份一般学校的学报上发表了探讨“知识自由”的文章。

*把我们这个学科领域中美国图书馆协会( American Library Association)把“知识自由”作为专业领域自由权竭尽全力提倡的行为大加赞赏。@@background-color:{{$:/palettes/Editor##highlight}};所谓“知识自由”是指“人人享有不受限制地寻求与接收各种观点的信息权利，应提供对各种思想所有表达的自由获取，从而可以发现某个问题、动机或运动的任何或所有方面。知识自由包括以下三个部分: 知识持有的自由，知识接收的自由和知识发布( 传播) 的自由。”@@
*简而言之，知识自由指追求知识的活动不被限制，在法律上属于人权范畴。
*联合国《世界人权宣言》第19 条宣称: “人人有权享有主张和发表意见的自由; 此项权利包括持有主张而不受干涉的自由，通过任何媒介和不论国界寻求、接受和传递信息与思想的自由。”知识自由是人权的重要组成部分，而思想自由是其基础。思想自由权作为一种背景性权利，是其他一切权利存在的前提。思想自由是一切自由的起点，包括言论自由、出版自由、结社自由、学术独立。@@color:{{$:/palettes/Editor##alt-text}};自由地思想是一切创造的源泉，是文明发展的基本动力，是人类存在的根本保证。@@
